item.title: Honoring the educational significance of Dr. Jane Goodall's work on this the 50th anniversary of the beginning of her work in Tanzania, Africa.

latestAction.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5858)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S5858-5859)

summary.text:
Recognizes the 50th anniversary of the beginning of Dr. Jane Goodall's work in what is now Tanzania as significant in scientific history.

Recognizes the significant role that Dr. Goodall's work and scientific study have had on our knowledge and understanding of both the natural and human worlds.

Recognizes the positive role that Dr. Goodall's work and research have had in education, science, and conservation alike.

bill.title: A resolution honoring the educational and scientific significance of Dr. Jane Goodall on the 50th anniversary of the beginning of her work in what is today Gombe Stream National Park in Tanzania.

item.title: A resolution honoring the educational and scientific significance of Dr. Jane Goodall on the 50th anniversary of the beginning of her work in what is today Gombe Stream National Park in Tanzania.
A resolution honoring the educational and scientific significance of Dr. Jane Goodall on the 50th anniversary of the beginning of her work in what is today Gombe Stream National Park in Tanzania.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5858)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
